tit.cmt: 以下「やまうちりゅう」の読みを使用します。
タイトルの頭文字を大文字に変更、(also read Yamanouchi school)→次文に移動

sen.j: 山内流（やまうちりゅう、やまのうちりゅう）は、大分県臼杵市に伝わる日本泳法の流派のひとつ。
sen.e: Yamauchi school is a style of Japanese Martial Arts Swimming maintained in Usuki City, Oita Prefecture.
Yamauchi school (also read Yamanouchi school) is a style of Japanese Martial Arts Swimming maintained in Usuki City, Oita Prefecture.
Yamauchi school (also read Yamanouchi school) is a style of Japanese Martial Arts Swimming maintained in Usuki City, Oita Prefecture.

sen.j: 臼杵山内流とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is also called Usuki Yamauchi school.
It is also called Usuki Yamauchi school.
It is also called Usuki Yamauchi school.

sen.j: 日本水泳連盟主催の日本泳法大会に参加する12流派のうちのひとつである。
sen.e: It is one of twelve styles that participate in Japanese Martial Arts Swimming Championship sponsored by Japan Swimming Federation.
It is one of the twelve styles that participate in Japanese Martial Arts Swimming Championship sponsored by Japan Swimming Federation.
sen.cmt: one of the twelve stylesとしました。
sen.e: It is one of the twelve styles that participate in Japanese Martial Arts Swimming Championship sponsored by Japan Swimming Federation.

sen.j: また、1966年3月22日に大分県の無形文化財に指定されている。
sen.e: It is also designated as an intangible cultural properties of Oita Prefecture, since March 22, 1966.
It is also designated as an intangible cultural properties of Oita Prefecture, since March 22, 1966.
It is also designated as an intangible cultural properties of Oita Prefecture, since March 22, 1966.

sen.j: 豊後水道に面する臼杵藩では、既に大友義鑑の治世に水練が始められたと伝えられ、古くから水練術が盛んであった。
sen.e: Swimming practice has been popular since old days in Usuki Domain, facing Bungo Suido (the channel between Kyushu and Shikoku Islands), and it is believed that swimming practice has already started during the region of Toshiaki OTOMO.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Swimming practice has been popular since old days in the Usuki Domain, facing Bungo Suido (the channel between Kyushu and Shikoku Islands), and it is believed that swimming practice has already started during the reign of Yoshiaki OTOMO.
sen.cmt: the Usuki Domainとし、region→reign、Toshiaki OTOMO→Yoshiaki OTOMOに修正
sen.e: Swimming practice has been popular since old days in the Usuki Domain, facing Bungo Suido (the channel between Kyushu and Shikoku Islands), and it is believed that swimming practice has already started during the reign of Yoshiaki OTOMO.

sen.j: しかし、江戸時代後期の文政5年（1822年）に神伝流を修めた伊予国伊予松山藩士の山内久馬勝重から臼杵藩士稲川清記が新たな泳法を伝授される。
sen.e: However in 1822 (the late Edo period) Seiki INAGAWA, a statesman of the Usuki, was instructed in new style of swimming from Kyuma Katsushige YAMAUCHI, a statesman of the Iyo-Matsuyama Clan Iyo Province, who studied Shinden school.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However in 1822 (the late Edo period) Seiki INAGAWA, a feudal retainer of the Usuki clan, was instructed in the new style of swimming from Kyuma Katsushige YAMAUCHI, a feudal retainer of the Iyo-Matsuyama clan, Iyo Province, who studied Shinden school.
sen.cmt: 統一リストより、a statesman of the Usuki→a feudal retainer of the Usuki clan、a statesman of the Iyo-Matsuyama Clan→a feudal retainer of the Iyo-Matsuyama clanに修正、in new style→in the new stykeとし、カンマ追加
sen.e: However in 1822 (the late Edo period) Seiki INAGAWA, a feudal retainer of the Usuki clan, was instructed in the new style of swimming from Kyuma Katsushige YAMAUCHI, a feudal retainer of the Iyo-Matsuyama clan, Iyo Province, who studied Shinden school.

sen.j: そして山内流と名付けられて以後臼杵藩の代表的な泳法となった。
sen.e: The style of swimming was named Yamauchi school and later became a notable swimming style of Usuki Domain.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The style of swimming was named Yamauchi school and later became a notable swimming style in the Usuki Domain.
sen.cmt: of Usuki Domain→in the Usuki Domainとしました。
sen.e: The style of swimming was named Yamauchi school and later became a notable swimming style in the Usuki Domain.

sen.j: 山内流泳法の基本は斜横泳と立ち泳ぎである。
sen.e: Basics of Yamauchi school swimming are swimming oblique side and treading water.
Basics of Yamauchi school swimming are swimming oblique side and treading water.
Basics of Yamauchi school swimming are swimming oblique side and treading water.

sen.j: 斜横泳は遠泳に適した泳法である。
sen.e: Swimming oblique side is a swimming style suited for long-distance swimming.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Swimming oblique side is a swimming style suited for long-distance swimming.
Swimming oblique side is a swimming style suited for long-distance swimming.

sen.j: 頭を正面に向け体を斜横にして、手は手繰手、足は三節扇足で泳ぐ。
sen.e: Swimming oblique side swims with head facing forward and body facing obliquely, stroke is taguri-te and leg movement is sansetsu aoriashi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処三節扇足の読み方については推測です。
sen.e: Swimming oblique side swims with head facing forward and body facing obliquely, stroke is taguri-te and leg movement is sansetsu aoriashi.
Swimming oblique side swims with head facing forward and body facing obliquely, stroke is taguri-te and leg movement is sansetsu aoriashi.

sen.j: 立泳は継扇足で、足だけで立ち泳ぎをしながら、大きな旗を振ったり、弓矢を引いたり、書道をするといった妙技は有名である。
sen.e: Treading water swims with tsugiaori ashi, and is famous with exquisite skills such as waving large flag, drawing a bow and performing calligraphy while treading water only with leg.
Treading water swims with tsugi aoriashi, and is famous with exquisite skills such as waving large flag, drawing a bow and performing calligraphy while treading water only with leg.
Treading water swims with tsugi aoriashi, and is famous with exquisite skills such as waving large flag, drawing a bow and performing calligraphy while treading water only with leg.

sen.j: これらは本来、水中で泳ぎながら戦を交えるための武術であった。
sen.e: These were originally a martial art to fight while swimming in the water.
These were originally a martial art to fight while swimming in the water.
These were originally a martial art to fight while swimming in the water.

sen.j: 現在では、毎年7月21日から20日間にわたって中津浦鯉来ヶ浜に游泳所が開かれている。
sen.e: Presently, swimming spot is opened annually on Nakatsuura Keireigahama for 20 days from July 21.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Presently, swimming spot is opened annually on Nakatsuura Keireigahama for 20 days from July 21.
Presently, swimming spot is opened annually on Nakatsuura Keireigahama for 20 days from July 21.

sen.j: 地元の児童などに術が伝授され、その最終日の8月10日には泳法披露が行われる。
sen.e: Techniques are taught to children in local neighborhood and there is a display of swimming on August 10, the last day of the event.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Techniques are taught to children in local neighborhood and there is a display of swimming on August 10, the last day of the event.
Techniques are taught to children in local neighborhood and there is a display of swimming on August 10, the last day of the event.

sen.j: また、毎年1月には同所で寒中水泳大会も開かれる。
sen.e: Also swimming in winter takes place in the same location in January every year.
Also swimming in winter takes place in the same location in January every year.
Also swimming in winter takes place in the same location in January every year.
